page.content: British Leyland Technology(Gaydon) moved from Solihull 5 or 6 years ago because what used to be Gaydon Airfield had 20 miles of runway and space to build new test facilities in an area in which security had always been important(Gaydon Airfield used to be the home of an R.A.F. V-bomber force). B.L.(Gaydon) does research and development for the makers of car components as well as for foreign car manufacturers and B.L. cars - although 95% of its income comes from work on B.L. cars.
